meanings.definition: The amount of light falling on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The room's illuminance increased as the sun shone through the window.
meanings.sent2: She adjusted the lamp to increase the illuminance in the room.
meanings.sent3: The illuminance on the table was so bright that it seemed like a spotlight.
meanings.sent4: Her smile brought an illuminance to the room, making everything seem warmer.
meanings.sent5: The illuminance of the full moon lit up the night sky beautifully.

meanings.definition: The brightness of a light source as perceived by the human eye.
meanings.sent1: The illuminance of the flashlight helped them find their way in the dark.
meanings.sent2: The illuminance of the stars in the night sky was breathtaking.
meanings.sent3: The illuminance of the neon sign made it stand out among the other shops.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter added an illuminance to the room, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent5: The illuminance of the sunrise painted the sky in vibrant colors.
